subSections.title: Etymology 2
subSections.text:
{{zh-forms|alt=腳,骹}}
Chinese sources commonly consider this to be a vernacular-layer descendant of Old Chinese {{och-l|骹|lower leg}}. It, however, bears great resemblance to the Tai etymon for “leg”, e.g. {{cog|th|ขา||leg}} < {{cog|tai-pro|*p.qaːᴬ||leg}} ({{zh-ref|Yue-Hashimoto, 1976}}; {{zh-ref|Luo, 1992}}). Such similarity may be superficial, as the Tai etymon is cognate with {{cog|qfa-kms-pro|*kwa||leg}} and there is a disagreement in rime ({{zh-ref|Schuessler, 2007}}).
